svcsubproc.title: Install SBA and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Hard Mount before November 1999
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 94 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install SBA and SFA cab for 5000 i series with rear hard mount before November 1999, use the following procedure.

step2.para: If removed, install chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 4) to frame rail (Item 18), both sides and install hex flanged head bolts and hex flanged lock nuts (Item 20). Tighten to 70 to 85 Lbf-ft (95 to 115 N•m).
If removed, install upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 11) to back of cab and install hex bolts, lock washers and flat washers (Item 19). Tighten to 30 to 38 Lbf-ft (41 to 51 N•m).

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing cab on chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Just before front cab mounting bracket (Item 3, View Circle A) is placed in the chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 4, View Circle A), position spacer (Item 14) and mounting bracket bushings (Item 13) in place in chassis front cab mounting bracket.

Lower cab so front cab mounting bracket (Item 3, View Circle A) bolt hole lines up with chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 4, View Circle A) bolt hole. This will hold spacer and mounting bracket bushings (Items 14 and 13) in place, then install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: From outboard side, install hex flanged head bolt (Item 1, View Circle A) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 3, View Circle A) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 4, View Circle A) with spacer and mounting bracket bushings (Items 14 and 13), both sides.
From inboard side, install hex flanged lock nut (Item 2, View Circle A) on hex flanged head bolt (Item 1, View Circle A), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position rear of cab so upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 11) bolt holes lines up with each insulator (Item 15) and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 12) bolt holes and install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install each hex head bolt (Item 5) with flat washer (Item 6), spring (Item 7), flat washer (Item 6), cab mounting insulator (Item 8), insulator retainer (Item 9) through upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 11), insulator (Item 15) and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 12).

From underneath the rear cab mounting crossmember (Item 16), install insulator retainer (Item 9), cab mounting insulator (Item 8), flat washer (Item 6) and hex lock nut (Item 10) on each hex head bolt (Item 5); do not tighten.
With cab located properly, tighten front cab mounting bracket hex flanged head bolt and hex flanged lock nut (Items 1 and 2), both sides. Tighten to 200 to 240 Lbf-ft (270 to 325 N•m).
With cab located properly, tighten rear cab mounting hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 5 and 10). Tighten until top washer is flush with top of sill.

svcsubproc.title: Install Front Cab Mounting Insulator for SBA and SFA 5000 i Series with Rear Hard Mount after November 1999
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 95 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before the cab is lowered onto the chassis, if it was necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 16), driver side shown. Install as follows.

Install front cab mounting insulator (Item 16) to chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), both sides. Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 18) through front cab mounting insulator and chassis front cab mounting bracket and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 17). Tighten to 115 to 140 Lbf-in (13 to 16 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Install SBA and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Hard Mount after November 1999
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 95 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install SBA and SFA cab for 5000 i series with rear hard mount after November 1999, use the following procedure.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing cab on chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Position cab so each front cab mounting bracket (Item 5) bolt hole lines up with front cab mounting insulator (Item 16) bolt hole and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) on each frame rail, then install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install hex head bolt (Item 1) with flat washer (Item 2) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 5), front cab mounting insulator (Item 16) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), both sides.
Install front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3) and hex lock nut (Item 4) on hex head bolt (Item 1), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position rear of cab so cab floor and upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 13) bolt holes line up with each rear cab mounting insulators (Item 15) and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 14) bolt holes and install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install each hex head bolt (Item 7) with flat washer (Item 8), spring (Item 9), flat washer (Item 8), rear cab mounting insulator (Item 10), rear cab mounting insulator retainer (Item 11) through cab floor and upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 13), rear cab mounting insulator (Item 15) and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 14).

From underneath the rear cab mounting crossmember (Item 19), install rear cab mounting insulator (Item 10), flat washer (Item 8) and hex lock nut (Item 12) on each hex head bolt (Item 7); do not tighten.
With cab located properly, tighten front cab mounting hex flanged head bolt and hex flanged lock nut (Items 1 and 4) both sides, tighten to 185 to 200 Lbf-ft (251 to 271 N•m).
With cab located properly, tighten rear cab mounting hex head bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 7 and 12), tighten until top washer is flush with top of sill.

svcsubproc.title: Install Front Cab Mounting Insulator for SBA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1994 and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1996
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 96 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before the cab is lowered onto the chassis, if it was necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 14), driver side shown. Install as follows.

Install front cab mounting insulator (Item 14) to chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), both sides. Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 16) through front cab mounting insulator and chassis front cab mounting bracket and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 15). Tighten to 115 to 140 Lbf-in (13 to 16 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Install SBA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1994 and SFA Cab for 5000 i Series with Rear Cab Air Suspension System after August 1996
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 96 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install SBA and SFA cab for 5000 i series with rear cab air suspension system, use the following procedure.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing cab on chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Position cab so each front cab mounting bracket (Item 5) bolt hole lines up with front cab mounting insulator (Item 14) bolt hole and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) on each frame rail, then install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install hex bolt with flat washer (Items 1 and 2) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 5), front cab mounting insulator (Item 14) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), both sides.
Then install front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3) and hex lock nut (Item 4) on hex head bolt (Item 1), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position rear of cab so bottom of cab floor and cab air suspension bracket mounting plate (Item 10) bolt holes line up with right side cab mounting bracket (Item 11) and left side cab mounting bracket (Item 12) bolt holes and install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install four hex flanged head bolts (Item 7), spacers (Item 8) and flat washers (Item 9) through cab floor and cab air suspension bracket mounting plate (Item 10) and thread into weld nuts of right side cab mounting bracket (Item 11) and left side cab mounting bracket (Item 12).
With cab located properly, tighten front cab mounting bracket hex bolt and flanged hex lock nut (Items 1 and 4), tighten to 185 to 200 Lbf-ft (251 to 271 N•m).

With cab located properly, tighten hex flanged head bolts (Item 7) into weld nuts of right side cab mounting bracket (Item 11) and left side cab mounting bracket (Item 12), tighten to 70 to 80 Lbf-ft (95 to 108.5 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Front Cab Mounting Insulator on Day Cab for 9100 i, 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Hard Mount
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 97 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before the cab is lowered onto the chassis, if it was necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 18), driver side shown. Install as follows.

Install front cab mounting insulator (Item 18) to chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides. Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 20) through front cab mounting insulator and chassis front cab mounting bracket and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 19). Tighten to 115 to 140 Lbf-in (13 to 16 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Install Day Cab for 9100 i, 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Hard Mount
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 97 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install day cab for 9100 i, 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i models with rear hard mount, use the following procedure.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing cab on chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Position cab so front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) bolt hole lines up with front cab mounting insulator (Item 18) bolt hole and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) on each frame rail, then install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install hex head bolt with flat washer (Items 1 and 2) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), front cab mounting insulator (Item 18) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides.
Then install front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) on hex head bolt (Item 1), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position rear of cab so upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 15) bolt holes line up with rear cab mounting insulator (Item 17) and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 16) bolt holes and install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install two hex bolts (Item 8) with flat washers (Item 9), springs (Item 10), rear rebound insulators (Item 11) and rebound insulator retainers (Item 12) through upper rear cab mounting bracket (Item 15), rear cab mounting insulators (Item 17) and lower rear cab mounting bracket (Item 16).
Then install rebound insulator retainers (Item 13), rear rebound insulators (Item 11) and flanged hex lock nuts (Item 14) on hex head bolts (Item 8); do not tighten.
Front cab mounting brackets (Item 6) and chassis front cab mounting brackets (Item 7) to be balanced to equal distance laterally to assure that cab is square to chassis before tightening bolts.
With cab located properly, tighten front cab mounting hex head bolt and hex flanged lock nut (Items 1 and 5), both sides. Tighten to 145 to 175 Lbf-ft (197 to 237 N•m).
With cab located properly, tighten rear cab mounting hex bolts and hex flanged lock nuts (Items 8 and 14). Tighten bolts until top washer is flush with top of sill.

svcsubproc.title: Install Front Cab Mounting Insulator on Day Cab for 9200 i Models with Detroit Diesel Engines and with Rear Cab Air Suspension System before January 1997
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 98 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before the cab is lowered onto the chassis, if it was necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 13), driver side shown. Install as follows.

Install front cab mounting insulator (Item 13) to chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides. Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 15) through front cab mounting insulator and chassis front cab mounting bracket and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 14). Tighten to 115 to 140 Lbf-in (13 to 16 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Install Day Cab for 9200 i Models with Detroit Diesel Engines and with Rear Cab Air Suspension System before January 1997
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 98 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install day cab for 9200 i models with Detroit diesel engines and with rear cab air suspension system before January 1997, use the following procedure.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing cab on chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Position cab so front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) bolt hole lines up with front cab mounting insulator (Item 13) bolt hole and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) on each frame rail, both sides, then install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install hex head bolt with flat washer (Items 1 and 2) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), front cab mounting insulator (Item 13) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides.
Then install front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) on hex head bolt (Item 1), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position rear of cab so cab floor and rear cab sill bracket (Item 11) bolt holes line up with cab air suspension system (Item 12) bolt holes and install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 8) with spacers (Item 9) and four flat washers (Item 10), two on each bolt (Item 8), through cab floor and rear cab sill bracket (Item 11) and thread into weld nuts of cab air suspension system (Item 12).
With cab located properly, tighten front cab mounting hex head bolt and hex flanged lock nut (Items 1 and 5), both sides. Tighten to 185 to 200 Lbf-ft (251 to 271 N•m).
With cab located properly, tighten hex flanged head bolts (Item 8) into weld nuts of cab air suspension system (Item 12), tighten to 70 to 80 Lbf-ft (95 to 108.5 N•m).

With cab located properly, tighten front cab mounting hex head bolt and hex flanged lock nut (Items 1 and 5), both sides. Tighten to 185 to 200 Lbf-ft (251 to 271 N•m).
With cab located properly, tighten hex flanged head bolts (Item 8) into weld nuts of cab air suspension system (Item 12), tighten to 70 to 80 Lbf-ft (95 to 108.5 N•m).

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Position cab so front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) bolt hole lines up with front cab mounting insulator (Item 13) bolt hole on chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) on each frame rail, both sides, then install mounting hardware as follows.

Then install front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) on hex head bolt (Item 1), both sides; do not tighten.

Tighten to 115 to 140 Lbf-in (13 to 16 N•m).

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Position cab so front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) bolt hole lines up with front cab mounting insulator (Item 13) bolt hole and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) on each frame rail, both sides, then install mounting hardware as follows.

Then install front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) on hex head bolt (Item 1), both sides; do not tighten.

svcsubproc.title: Install Front Cab Mounting Insulator on 51 Inch or 72 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i and 9400 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 102 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before the cab is lowered onto the chassis, if it was necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 12), driver side shown. Install as follows.

Install front cab mounting insulator (Item 12) to chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides. Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 14) through front cab mounting insulator and chassis front cab mounting bracket and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 13). Tighten to 115 to 140 Lbf-in (13 to 16 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Install 51 Inch or 72 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i and 9400 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 102 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install 51 inch or 72 inch pro-sleeper® cab for 9200 i and 9400 i models with rear cab air suspension system, use the following procedure.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing cab on chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Position cab so front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) bolt hole lines up with front cab mounting insulator (Item 12) bolt hole and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) on each frame rail, both sides, then install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install hex head bolt with flat washer (Items 1 and 2) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), front cab mounting insulator (Item 12) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides.
Then install front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) on hex head bolt (Item 1), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position rear of cab so cab floor and rear cab sill bracket (Item 10) bolt holes line up with cab air suspension system (Item 11) bolt holes and install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install six hex head bolts (Item 8) and flat washers (Item 9) through rear cab sill bracket (Item 10) and thread into weld nuts of cab air suspension system (Item 11).
With cab located properly, tighten front cab mounting hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 1 and 5), both sides. Tighten to 185 to 200 Lbf-ft (251 to 271 N•m).
With cab located properly, tighten six hex flanged head bolts (Item 8) into weld nuts of cab air suspension system (Item 11), tighten to 70 to 80 Lbf-ft (95 to 108.5 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Front Cab Mounting Insulator on 51 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 103 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before the cab is lowered onto the chassis, if it was necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 11), driver side shown. Install as follows.

Install front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) to chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides. Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 13) through front cab mounting insulator and chassis front cab mounting bracket and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 12). Tighten to 115 to 140 Lbf-in (13 to 16 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Install 51 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 103 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: To install 51 inch pro-sleeper® cab for 9200 i and 9400 i models with rear cab air suspension system on vehicles after April 2000, use the following procedure.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing cab on chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Position cab so front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) bolt hole lines up with front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) bolt hole on chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) on each frame rail, both sides, then install mounting hardware as follows.

note.para: On 9900 vehicles manufactured at Escobedo there will be two flat washers (Item 2) found on each side under hex head bolt (Item 1).

step2.para: Install hex head bolt with flat washer (Items 1 and 2) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides.
Then install front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) on hex head bolt (Item 1), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position rear of cab so rear cab sill bracket (Item 9) bolt holes line up with cab air suspension system (Item 10) bolt holes and install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install six hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 8) through cab air suspension system (Item 10) and thread into weld nuts of rear cab sill bracket (Item 9).
With cab located properly, tighten front cab mounting hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 1 and 5), both sides. Tighten to 185 to 200 Lbf-ft (251 to 271 N•m).
With cab located properly, tighten six hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 8) into weld nuts of rear cab sill bracket (Item 9), tighten to 70 to 80 Lbf-ft (95 to 108.5 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Front Cab Mounting Insulator on 72 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 104 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before the cab is lowered onto the chassis, if it was necessary to replace the front cab mounting insulator (Item 11), driver side shown. Install as follows.

Install front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) to chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides. Install two hex flanged head bolts (Item 13) through front cab mounting insulator and chassis front cab mounting bracket and install two hex flanged lock nuts (Item 12). Tighten to 115 to 140 Lbf-in (13 to 16 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting insulator.

svcsubproc.title: Install 72 Inch Pro-Sleeper® Cab for 9200 i, 9400 i and 9900 i Models with Rear Cab Air Suspension System on Vehicles after April 2000
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 104 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: To install 72 inch pro-sleeper® cab for 9200 i and 9400 i models with rear cab air suspension system on vehicles after April 2000, use the following procedure.

note.para: Use an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture when installing cab on chassis. Pad lifting fixture to prevent damage to cab assembly.

step1.para: Carefully lift cab into position over chassis.

Carefully lower cab down to chassis. Position cab so front cab mounting bracket (Item 6) bolt hole lines up with front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) bolt hole and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7) on each frame rail, both sides, then install mounting hardware as follows.

note.para: On 9900 vehicles manufactured at Escobedo there will be two flat washers (Item 2) found on each side under hex head bolt (Item 1).

step2.para: Install hex head bolt with flat washer (Items 1 and 2) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 6), front cab mounting insulator (Item 11) and chassis front cab mounting bracket (Item 7), both sides.
Then install front cab mounting safety stop (Item 3), flat washer (Item 4) and hex lock nut (Item 5) on hex head bolt (Item 1), both sides; do not tighten.

step1.para: Position rear of cab so cab floor and rear cab sill bracket (Item 9, Figure 103) bolt holes line up with cab air suspension system (Item 10) bolt holes and install mounting hardware as follows.

step2.para: Install six hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 8) through cab air suspension system (Item 10) and thread into weld nuts of rear cab sill bracket (Item 9).
With cab located properly, tighten front cab mounting hex head bolt and hex lock nut (Items 1 and 5), both sides. Tighten to 185 to 200 Lbf-ft (251 to 271 N•m).
With cab located properly, tighten six hex head screw sems assemblies (Item 8) into weld nuts of rear cab sill bracket (Item 9, Figure 103), tighten to 70 to 80 Lbf-ft (95 to 108.5 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: General Guidelines For Installation
svcsubproc.para: The following steps provide a guideline sequence for cab installation. The details of the installation procedure vary for different vehicle models, and for special equipment and accessories.

step1.para: Install transmission gearshift lever. Refer to GROUP - 13, TRANSMISSION in the Master Service Manual.
Connect heater hoses, clutch linkage, engine shut-off control cable, brake air lines and hoses, and auxiliary oil filter hose.
Connect wiring harness connectors to cab dash and floor panels.
Connect accelerator linkage and cruise-control, if so equipped.
Install steering gear universal joint at steering gear.
Connect battery ground cable and frame-to-cab ground cable.
Attach any other connections between cab and frame, if required.
Connect air conditioning system lines, if so equipped and charge air conditioning system. Refer to GROUP 16 - CAB in the Master Service Manual for proper procedures.

Square cab relative to frame. Refer to ADJUSTMENTS,
CAB SQUARING
.
Start vehicle and charge air system, also check for leaks at all coolant hose connections.
On SBA 5000 i series (with fiberglass tilt hood), SFA 5000 i series and 9000 i series, install air cleaner ducts, if required and close tilt hood and latch hood latches on both sides.
On SBA 5000 i series (with butterfly hood), install air cleaner ducts, stay rods and hood. Refer to GROUP 09 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS in the Master Service Manual.
Set parking brake and remove blocks from vehicle wheels. Road test vehicle before returning it to service.

svcsubproc.title: Paint as Required
svcsubproc.para: To paint a replaced or repaired panel, refer to GROUP 16 - PAINT in the Master Service Manual.

svcsubproc.title: Reinstall Related Components
svcsubproc.para: To install removed components, refer to the proper section in the Master Service Manual.
